name: Himalayan Tahr
description: They have long fur with a dense undercoat that protects them from harsh winters. Both sexes have pointed horns, though those of females are weaker and shorter. Males also boast a thick mane on their neck and shoulders.
image_alt: Himalayan Tahr, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
proportions: Body length 90–140 cm, tail length 9–12 cm, shoulder height 60–110 cm, weight 50–100 kg
attractions: Tahrs are mainly active in the morning, heading up to pastures, and in the evening, descending to lower elevations. Their hooves are perfectly adapted for agile movement in rugged terrain.
breeding: The first tahr arrived at the zoo in 1933 from the Kludský Circus. It lived less than a year, with tahrs reappearing in 1973; the first offspring was raised in 1978.
